At least three people were shot and killed, while several others were injured. Local authorities prohibited cultural events on the streets after the attack. Another source stated that the shooters were in a vehicle and that the victims were at a birthday party, although this was not confirmed by other reports. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. At least 3 fatalities, at least 2 injured.

On 23 June 2023, off the Coast of Lafiteau, Ouest, armed pirates, described as gang members, attacked a ship known as 'Children's Lives', killed the captain (methods unknown), and kidnapped five members of the crew and 25 passengers. The corpse of the captain was burned and the ship was looted. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 June 2023, off the Coast of Mariani, Ouest, armed pirates, described as gang members, abducted the crew of a ship known as 'Thanks God'. The captain, three sailors, and six passengers were kidnapped. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 21 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, a mob of residents, called by members of a self-defense group, threw stones at a police patrol to grab three detained gangsters who were traveling inside the vehicle in Laboule 12 neighborhood. The stones injured a policeman, while the mob killed and burned the detained three men in what was described as a vigilante violence attack. One source stated that the detained men were former members of the Ti Makak gang. Another version claimed they were grabbed when trying to escape the police. 3 fatalities, 1 injured.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; Metropole; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 20 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang kidnapped the former president of the Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) and owner of the Tele Pluriel TV channel when he was about to reach his residence. The gangsters asked for a ransom of 1 million dollars as a condition for his liberation. The family claimed not to have that amount of money. Another source stated that despite the payment of a first ransom, kidnappers demanded an additional one. The victim was released on 25 August.

source: Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Vitelhomme gang during a security operation in the Torcelle neighborhood. At least one individual was injured, although his/her affiliation was not clarified. The police intervention took place amidst a gang offensive in the Tabarre commune (coded separately). At least 1 injured.

source: Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; VOA
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, employees of the National Port Authority (APN) held a demonstration in front of the institution's facilities on 18 Boulevard Street to demand the release of the regional head of the APN, kidnapped during an attack in the Tabarre commune on 17 June (coded separately). Demonstrators burned tires and blocked roads. Police forces were deployed, although no interaction with the demonstrators was reported. Firefighters put out the burning tires.

source: Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti
notes: On 19 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang kidnapped the head of the Vorbe et Fils company at the company's facilities. The entrepreneur was released some hours later under unknown circumstances.

On 19 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang fired shots in the Freres and Pernier neighborhoods. Gunshots were heard near the National Police School and the residence of a former Colonel of the Armed Forces of Haiti was attacked (the nature of the attack is unknown). Gunshots by Vitelhomme gangsters were also heard in the Tabarre commune (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 18 June 2023, overnight, in Bon Repos, Ouest, members of the Canaan gang kidnapped seven private security guards while they were on service at the Bon Repos Zilda Arns community hospital. There is no further information on the circumstances of the kidnapping and the whereabouts of the victims are unknown. The gangsters stole medical equipment, materials, and vehicles.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 18 June 2023, near Marin, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped at least five civilians in La Plaine du Sac-de-Cul area. Later that day, armed men kidnapped another person who was at the Jacques Stephen Alexis School compound between Marin and Bon Repos. There is no further information on the perpetrators of these abductions, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 18 June 2023, in Port-Salut, Sud, unidentified perpetrators shot and killed a police officer. He was shot in the back of the head. 1 fatality.

source: Haiti Progress; Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of an unidentified gang in the Savane Pistache neighborhood. During the clash, a gangster was shot and injured, and a riffle was seized by the officers. The wounded was lynched by a mob of residents moments later (coded separately). 1 injured.

source: Haiti Progress; Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a mob of residents lynched a gangster in the Savane Pistache neighborhood. The gangster was grabbed by the rioters after having been injured in a clash with police forces (coded separately). The attack was described as vigilante violence. 1 fatality.

source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 17 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang kidnapped the regional head of the National Port Authority (APN) during an attack against the vehicle he was traveling on his way home in the Torcelle neighbourhood. His private driver was shot and killed during the attack. The gangsters asked for a ransom of 1 million USD as a condition for his release. He was liberated on 9 July after several ransoms had been paid. 1 fatality.

On 16 June 2023, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, a group of brokers and stevedores protested at the customs office to oppose the increase in customs clearance taxes for vehicles. Protesters blocked the entrance of the office.

On 16 June 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified armed men in a vehicle shot at the car of a man who was on his way to work, in the Bozo area (drive-by). The attack was part of a kidnapping attempt that was prevented as police forces on patrol immediately intervened and scared away the kidnappers using their fire weapons. The armed men fled the scene. There were no fatalities.

Around 15 June 2023 (between 1 - 22 June), in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces shot and killed at least three gangsters during anti-gang operations in the commune. Seven vehicles, 10 fire weapons, and ammunition were seized during these operations. At least 3 fatalities.

source: Alterpresse; El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 15 June 2023, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, more than 30 workers from the Industrial Development Corporation (CODEVI) rioted at the company's facilities as a response to the aggression of an employee by a security guard moments before. The rioters set fire to a company building, broke windows, destroyed a vehicle, and looted a service station and a police station. Police forces intervened, shooting and killing two workers and a 14-year-old boy and injuring 15 others. A woman lost her leg, while a teenager got a hand severely injured. 3 fatalities, 15 injured.

source: Loop News Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; VOA
notes: On 14 June 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, gang members shot and injured the National Commission for Disarmament, Demobilization, and Reintegration (CNDDR) coordinator in Lilavwa 14 neighborhood. During the clash, an armed man was killed, and several others were injured. The motivation for the attack was not clarified, although it is known that the CNDDR members are the target of intimidation due to their work on researching files about the finance of gangs. The coordinator's car received 13 shots during the incident. 1 fatality, at least 3 injured.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Progress; Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 13 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, 30 members of the Vitelhomme gang kidnapped a female journalist from Radio Vision 2000 at her residence. According to the victim, the gangsters entered the property, threatened to kill her, asked her for money and weapons, and looted the house before taking her to a stronghold place of the gang. The gang leader interrogated her before releasing her later that day. The gangsters kept her vehicle, although no ransom was paid for her liberation.

On 12 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Vitelhomme gang near the US Embassy and the Vehicle Insurance Office Against Third Parties (OAVCT). The police intervened as gunshots had been heard in the commune. Following the intervention, the policemen took the control of the situation. Casualties unknown.

source: Gazette Haiti; Jamaica Gleaner; Le Nouvelliste; Metropole; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 12 June 2023, overnight, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang attacked, looted, vandalized, and set fire to the facilities of the Jamaican Honorary Consulate and the Sun Auto vehicles dealership, both located at the same building. More than 40 employees were held at gunpoint and prevented from leaving the compound, while police forces guarding the Consulate and security guards from the dealership went missing. Several vehicles were stolen. Following the attack, the Jamaican authorities announced the suspension of consular services in Haiti. This action occurred as regional and international political leaders were meeting in Jamaica to discuss the security situation in Haiti. Casualties unknown.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 10 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gang members killed a police officer (methods unknown) on Rue des Casernes Street, near the National Archives. 1 fatality.

All the house occupants managed to leave the property before it was set on fire by the gangsters. There were no casualties.
Around 6 June 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men killed a gang member in Cite Militare. Methods and circumstances of the clash are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 6 June 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified gang members shot, killed, and burned a business man and his cousin during an attack in Cite Militaire. The victims were moving in a vehicle when they were ambushed. The same day, unidentified armed men, thought to be gang members, killed another person in Cite Militare. Methods and circumstances of the attack are unknown. 3 fatalities.
On 6 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified individuals looted the Episcopal University of Haiti. There are no further details of the event.

On 5 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, a group of police officers held a protest next to the facilities of the Drug Trafficking Squat (BLTS) to demand the resignation of the head of this unit. The protest was held amidst a labor strike by policemen to demand the release of an arrested policeman.

Around 4 June 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a mob of residents attacked at least two men in Turgeau neighbourhood. One man got his hand cut, while the other was burned on the face with gasoline. The attack was described as vigilante violence by affiliates of the Bwa Kale Movement. According to one of the mobsters, the victims were attacked because no one in the community recognized them. It is likely that they were accused of being gang members, as the Bwa Kale Movement has perpetrated vigilante attacks on this premise. It is unclear whether the victims were killed. At least 2 injured.

Around 4 June 2023 (as reported), in Les Cayes, Sud, a mob of residents killed two men on a motorcycle (methods unknown). The attack was described as vigilante violence by affiliates of the Bwa Kale Movement. The motivation of the attack was not clarified, although it is likely that the victims were accused of being gang members by the mobsters. A relative of one of the victims claimed that his cousin, the passenger of the motorcycle, was an innocent civilian. 2 fatalities.

On 3 June 2023, in Marin, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, gang members kidnapped several civilians in the village and in the nearby Fourgy area. According to residents, the kidnappers were members of the Canaan Gang. Between 2 and 3 June, at least 10 people were kidnapped in locations belonging to the Plaine du Cul-de-Sac area, including Marin, Sibert, Fourgy, and the 9 Road. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown. 10 victims split across four events coded by ACLED.

On 3 June 2023, in Sibert, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, gang members kidnapped several civilians. According to residents, the kidnappers were members of the Canaan Gang. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown. 10 victims split across four events coded by ACLED.

On 3 June 2023, near Arnaud, Artibonite, a mob of residents lynched a truck driver in the Artibonite Valley. According to the mobsters, the victim carried a quantity of ammunition that was expected to be delivered to members of the Gran Grif de Savien gang. The attack was described as vigilante violence. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2023, in Marin, Ouest, gang members kidnapped several civilians in the village and in the nearby Fourgy area. According to residents, the kidnappers were members of the Canaan Gang. On 2 June 2023, in Sibert, Ouest, gang members kidnapped several civilians. According to residents, the kidnappers were members of the Canaan Gang. On 2 June 2023, in Les Cayes, Sud, residents held a protest to demand repairs on the road leading to the Torbeck commune. Some protesters demanded the resignation of Prime Minister Ariel Henry.

On 1 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the commune. The authorship was not clarified, although perpetrators were likely to be Twi Bwa gang members and police forces, who clashed in the area during the two days prior. Casualties unknown.

On 1 June 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, tens of citizens, armed with machetes and sticks, took to the streets in the Thor and Cote Plage neighborhoods to decry the violence of gangs in the commune. The protest was held as the Ti Bwa gang had attacked residents and clashed with police forces in the Bizoton neighborhood on 30 and 31 May (coded separately).

source: Haiti Standard; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 1 June 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified armed men in a vehicle without licence plate shot and killed at least four people in the 'Rosemberg' area (drive-by). The motivation of the attack was not clarified, although some victims were described as troublemakers and one was said to be involved in land conflicts. At least 4 fatalities.

On 1 June 2023, in the commune of L'Estere, Artibonite, police forces shot and injured an unspecified number of Kokorat San Ras gangsters during a security operation in the Croix-Perisse communal section. During the police intervention, two robbed vehicles were recuperated. Several injured.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; Metropole
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, police forces clashed with members of the Ti Bwa gang in the Bizoton neighborhood as they tried to take control of the Omega police station. During the crossfire, stray bullets injured several people (affiliation unknown). Armed with white weapons, thousands of residents joined the policemen and managed to expel the gangsters (coded separately). This happened a day after the Ti Bwa gang attacked residents and clashed with police forces in the commune (coded separately). Several injured.

On 31 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, a mob of residents killed and burned at least two people in Cote Plage 16 and Waney areas. The attacks were described as vigilante violence by affiliates of the Bwa Kale Movement. According to one source, the victims were allies of the Ti Bwa Gang. Another source stated that the attack was motivated by the opposition of the victims to support the initiative of other residents to join police forces to expel the Ti Bwa gang from the commune. This happened as members of this gang attacked residents and clashed with police forces in the commune earlier that day and the day before (coded separately). At least 2 fatalities.

On 31 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, teachers took to the streets to demand the adjustment of their salaries. They were joined by students from public schools, who demanded the return of teachers to classrooms. They also asked for a response to the teachers' claims by the authorities.

source: Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 31 May 2023, in Miragoane, Nippes, several hundred residents took to the streets holding tree branches to oppose rumors claiming that the police commissioner of the Nippes department would be transferred to Jacmel. Protesters blocked National Road 2. The rumors were later denied by the commissioner.

On 31 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Grand-Ravine gang during a security operation in the capital. During the police intervention, two riffles were seized by police forces. Casualties unknown.

On 30 May 2023, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, police forces shot and killed two gang members during a security operation that aimed at arresting the leader of the Fausto Depena gang and his accomplices, who had been intercepted at a house in Barriere Bouteille area (Southern entrance of the city). When the officers arrived, the gangsters opened fire, leading to a clash. The leader of the gang managed to escape together with other members of the organization. 2 fatalities.
On 30 May 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets commune, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two members of the 400 Mawozo Gang during a clash. 2 fatalities.
On 30 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a member of the Ti Makak gang in Thomassin 32. 1 fatality.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; Metropole; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, police forces clashed with Ti Bwa gang members at the moment they perpetrated an attack against residents of the Bizoton neighborhood. The gang members shot and killed a civilian at a gambling counter and a taxi driver, while several other civilians were injured. The gangsters were described as men moving in a vehicle by several sources (drive-by). During the armed clash, a police officer -and former ally of the Ti Bwa gang- was shot and killed, and the gangsters took his body, while at least two gangsters were killed. The rest managed to escape. According to unofficial statements, the gang attack was motivated by claims related to changes requested in the chain of command of the Carrefour jurisdiction. Several residents fled the area. At least 5 fatalities.

On 30 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, employees of the Social Assistance Box (CAS) protested to demand the replacement of the head of the institution after she was arrested for her involvement in a corruption case. The first protest on this claim was held on 23 May (coded separately).

On 30 May 2023, in Fort-Liberte, Nord-Est, hundreds of students from public schools, accompanied by teachers, took to the streets and gathered next to the departmental headquarters of the Ministry of National Education and Vocational Training (MENFP) to demand the return of teachers to classrooms, as they went on strike. They also demanded that the authorities meet the teachers' claims.

On 30 May 2023, overnight, in Fort-Liberte, Nord-Est, a mob of residents, armed with machetes, stabbed two men to death. The victims were accused of being thieves. The attack was described as vigilante violence. 2 fatalities.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 30 May 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, a police officer was killed (methods unknown) in Beudet area. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 29 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, employees of the Social Assistance Box (CAS) protested to demand the replacement of the head of the institution after she was arrested for her involvement in a corruption case. The first protest on this claim was held on 23 May (coded separately).

On 29 May 2023, overnight, in Leogane, Ouest, police forces carried out an operation to release an abducted person in Dufort area. During the intervention, one kidnapper was killed (believed to have died from gunshots), and two others were arrested. The kidnapped victim was released after being kidnapped 22 days earlier under unknown circumstances. 1 fatality.

Around 28 May 2023 (weekend of), near Marin, Ouest, unidentified armed men perpetrated several kidnappings, one of them on National Road 1. There is no information on the victims and the circumstances of these abductions, although according to residents the kidnappers were gangsters from Canaan. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

Around 28 May 2023 (weekend of), in Morpeau, Ouest, unidentified armed men perpetrated a kidnapping on Moleard Road. There is no information on the victims and the circumstances of the abduction, although according to residents the kidnappers were gangsters from Canaan. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 28 May 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified armed men moving in a robbed vehicle kidnapped a person in the Lilavois neighborhood. The police intervened and chased the perpetrators while they were fleeing with the victim. The officers managed to release the abducted man and seized the car that belonged to the Episcopal Conference of Haiti. The kidnappers were gangsters from Canaan, according to residents, and fled the scene in another vehicle that they robbed in situ to a moto-taxi driver.

On 26 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a group of residents marched with banners from Fernand Street in the Canape-Vert neighborhood to demand better living conditions and equitable access to medical treatment for HIV patients. On 25 May 2023, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, a group of moto taxi drivers, some of them armed with fire weapons, shot and injured a border agent during an altercation at a customs point. On 25 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang raped and burned alive two women in Village de Dieu accusing them of treason because they exposed the gang's activities to third parties. 2 fatalities.

On 24 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students from the National School of Applied Geology (ENGA) held a sit-in protest in front of the Ministry of National Education and Vocational Training (MENFP), in Nazon neighborhood, to demand the relocation of the school to a safer location.

notes: On 24 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Gran-Ravine gang shot and killed a student and injured several residents in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighborhood. On 24 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, members of the Vitelhomme gang attacked residents in the Bellevue La Montagne neighborhood, killing at least 10 people between 23 and 24 May. At least 10 fatalities split across two events coded by ACLED.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti

On 23 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang attacked residents in the Bellevue La Montagne neighborhood, killing at least 10 people between 23 and 24 May. At least 10 fatalities split across two events coded by ACLED.

On 23 May 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several workers of the National Company of Industrial Parks (SONAPI) took to the streets to demand a raise of the minimum wage. On 12 April 2023, in Miragoane, Nippes, a group of passport demanders held a protest at the Immigration Regional Direction facilities to demand the arrest of employees whom they accused of corruption. They also asked for their replacement by new staff members. Protesters blocked with chains the entrance of the Immigration Regional Direction building.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 12 April 2023, in Montrouis, Artibonite, unidentified gang members ambushed a vehicle at National Road 1, shooting and killing a lawyer traveling inside. The lawyer was decapitated, dragged by a car, burned, and abandoned. Another source stated that the lawyer was moved to a nearby area, where he was killed and thrown into the sea. Other passengers of the vehicle were robbed. The attack's motivation was not clarified, although the lawyer defended farmers and families involved in a land conflict in Piatre, which might be connected to the attack. Two suspects, including an interim executive from the Montrouis city hall, were arrested in connection with the killing. 1 fatality.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang

A pick-up vehicle, some beds, wardrobes, and other materials that were inside were stolen. A school bus parked nearby was set on fire. The police station had been abandoned by the officers three months ago.

source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti
notes: On 11 April 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang moving on a motorcycle kidnapped the head of the Canal Bleu TV channel on Freres Road when he was on his way home. Kidnappers, who contacted the son of the abducted, released the victim on 20 April after a ransom payment.

On 10 April 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed at least three Ti Makak gangsters during a police operation in Thomassin and Valle Heureuse neighborhoods. The leader of the gang was said to have be injured during the attack, although authorities did not confirm this information. His death was officially announced on 24 April. Unofficial statements claimed that seven gangsters were killed in total, although only three mentioned above were confirmed by authorities. The operation was carried out a day after Ti Makak gangsters had killed three police officers and injured another one in Thomassin 32 (coded separately). At least 3 fatalities.

notes: Around 10 April 2023 (between 5 - 15 April), in Montrouis, Artibonite, dozens of gangsters attacked residential areas, killing at least one person (methods unknown) and setting fire to 25 houses in different neighbourhoods of the commune. Several sources stated that the intended targets of the attack were farmers from the Tet Kole Ti Peyizan Movement, as part of a set of gang attacks aiming at grabbing their lands. At least 1 fatality.

Around 9 April 2023 (weekend of), in Thomazeau, Ouest, members of the Canaan gang attacked residents in Onaville Citerne and Onaville 16, 18, and 22 neighborhoods. Several people were killed (methods unknown), and their bodies were burned. The gangsters looted and set fire to some houses and set up roadblocks with barricades to prevent police forces from circulating in the area. According to the gangsters, the victims were members of a self-defence group operating in the area. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Jamaica Observer; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 9 April 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed three Ti Makak gangsters on a motorcycle during an operation in the Thomassin neighbourhood. In reprisal for this, members of the Ti Makak gang ambushed seven police officers in a patrol later that day in Thomassin 32. Three officers were killed, and one was injured. A video on social media showed the three corpses next to a motorcycle. The police recuperated the bodies. 6 fatalities, 1 injured.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Haiti); Tet Kole Ti Peyizan Ayisyen; Labor Group (Haiti)
notes: On 9 April 2023, in Montrouis, Artibonite, unidentified gang members attacked the Wahoo Bay Beach hotel, damaging the infrastructure. Gunshots were heard during the day. Several sources stated that the intended targets of the attack were farmers from the Tet Kole Ti Peyizan Movement, as part of a set of gang attacks aiming at grabbing their lands. Casualties unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Haiti); Tet Kole Ti Peyizan Ayisyen
notes: Property destruction: On 8 April 2023, in Montrouis, Artibonite, unidentified armed men occupied, looted, and set fire to farmers' crops belonging to the Tet Kole Ti Peyizan Movement in the Piatre area.

On 6 April 2023, in Thomazeau, Ouest, overnight, members of the Canaan gang opened fire in the Onaville neighborhood. Several residents were killed, and houses were looted and set on fire. Some families fled the area on 7 April. Unknown number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 5 April 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, gang members attacked the vehicle driven by a doctor and head of the National Laboratory of Public Health, and kidnapped him. The doctor was severely injured due to the shards of glass from the vehicle. The gangsters took him to a hospital, where he was released. 1 injured.

On 5 April 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, Vitelhomme gang members set fire to a police station and an antenna, spreading panic in the Meyotte neighborhood. Several families fled the scene due to the presence of the gangsters. Local reports stated the gang is trying to take control of the area. There were no casualties.
On 5 April 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, Vitelhomme gang members shot and killed a man during a kidnapping attempt. 1 fatality.

On 3 April 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the feminist movement, called by the Marijan organization, held a march to demand respect for women's rights. They specifically called on further labor inclusion. The march was held on the 37th anniversary of the birth of the Haitian Women's Movement.

On 2 April 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped two medical students in Delmas 75. The victims were about to submit their final thesis when they were abducted. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, but the latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

source: Haiti Progress; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti
notes: On 1 April 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, police forces shot and killed the leader of the Jerusalem 3 gang and another member of the gang during a clash in Canaan neighbourhood. The killed gangsters were allies of the Canaan gang. 2 fatalities.

On 1 April 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two gang members during an intervention to prevent the kidnapping of a person. The gangsters, who were driving a vehicle with the abducted victim, saw the officers and shot at them, leading to a clash that took place between the Oswald and Saint Honore streets (drive-by). The victim managed to escape unharmed thanks to the police intervention. 2 fatalities.

On 30 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, armed men kidnapped several people, including three supermarket employees. Local reports suggested the kidnapping was gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.
On 30 March 2023, Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two gang members who were thought to belong to the Vitelhomme Gang. 2 fatalities.

Other: On 30 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots and detonations were heard along the day in Lalue, Bourdon, Nazon, and Christ-Roi neighbourhoods. The authorship and circumstances were not clarified. Gang attacks were reported on the same day in Petionville.

On 30 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, lawyers held a protest to demand the resumption of activities in the courts, stopped for several weeks due to a strike held by deputy government commissioners and court clerks.
On 30 March 2023, in Thomazeau, Ouest, police forces intervened in the Onaville neighbourhood and clashed with members of the Canaan Gang, who tried ransom residents in the area. Casualties unknown.

On 30 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped a nine-year-old girl on Freres Road. The abduction occurred when the minor and her aunt were going to her grandfather's house. According to relatives, the kidnappers contacted the family on 3 April, but no further information was reported. There is no additional information on the perpetrators of the abduction, but the latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Progress; Le Nouvelliste; Metropole
notes: On 30 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men kidnapped several people in Nazon and Bois-Verna neighborhoods. Among the victims were a doctor and his employee, abducted from a private clinic. Local reports suggested the kidnapping was gang-related. The victims were released around 3 May 2023 after a ransom was paid.

source: Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 30 March 2023, overnight, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, more than 100 members of the Vitelhomme Gang attacked the Calebasse and Fort-Jacques residential areas, among others, by setting fire to houses and vehicles. Tens of members of the Vitelhomme Gang entered the Vivy Mitchell area in Les Palmes village and also attacked residential areas. A man -who was said to be the driver of a judge- was shot and killed, while at least a police officer was kidnapped. The gangsters set up barricades and roadblocks to prevent police forces from entering the area; however, authorities claimed that the police intervened (methods unknown) and took control of the situation. The attack was said to be in reprisal for the lynching of a gangster earlier that day (coded separately). Several fatalities were reported by the National Human Rights Defense Network in Calebasse, Fort-Jacques. At least 2 fatalities split in two events coded by ACLED.

source: Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 30 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Kenscoff, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme Gang attacked the Berette neighborhood by setting fire to houses and vehicles. There were several kidnappings attempts. The attack was said to be in reprisal for the lynching of a gangster in Petionville earlier that day (coded separately). Several fatalities were reported by the National Human Rights Defense Network in Berette and two other neighborhoods of Petionville. At least 2 fatalities split in two events coded by ACLED.

source: Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 30 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, residents held members of the Vitelhomme Gang who tried to kidnap residents in the Fort-Jacques neighborhood. The mob lynched a gangster to prevent the criminals from taking away their victims. The gangsters set fire to a vehicle. Police forces claimed to have intervened (methods unknown). In reprisal for this, more than 100 gangsters returned later that day and attacked residents (coded separately). 1 fatality.

Around 30 March 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, gang members kidnapped a Telemax female journalist when she was about to pay a ransom to the kidnappers of an abducted man. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

On 29 March 2023, Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces shot and injured a number of citizens during an intervention to disperse a crowd of people as an altercation was registered at a Centre for the delivery of identity documents (CRLDI). There was a woman among the injured. At least 2 injured.

On 29 March 2023, Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, gunshots, and detonations were heard in the Brooklyn area. The authorship was not clarified, although reports suggest this could be related to the G-Pep Gang that controls the neighborhood. Clashes between unidentified rival gangs and attacks were reported between 25 and 27 March (coded separately) in other areas Cite Soleil. Casualties unknown.

On 29 March 2023, Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of social and political organizations held a sit-in protest in Champs de Mars to decry insecurity and the deterioration of the socio-political scene in Haiti. The protest was held on the occasion of the 36th anniversary of the 1987 Constitution.

On 28 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces shot and killed another officer accidentally during a clash against gang members in Poste Marchand. The police officers were trying to release a woman who had been kidnapped in Delmas moments before. As a result of the police intervention, the woman was released and the gangsters ran away. 1 fatality.

On 27 March 2023, Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, gang members attacked the Terminal Varreux SA facilities, in La Saline area. Two workers taking part in a food offloading operation were injured by gunshots. 2 injured.

On 27 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, people held a sit-in protest in front of the first instance court to demand the release of a lawyer kidnapped on 20 Mars (coded separately). They also demanded that the government assumes its responsibilities in the face of insecurity.

Around 27 March 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, health workers from the Sanatorium Hospital blocked access to the health center and prevented patients from leaving the building during a demonstration to decry the lack of proper working conditions. A hospital security guard was physically aggressed by a rioter (health state unknown)

On 26 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two members of the Canaan Gang in Caradeux neighbourhood. The gangsters were trying to ransom residents in the area when the police killed them. 2 fatalities.

It is known that there was an off-duty police officer, students, and Protestant parishioners among the kidnapping victims. Some of them were on their way to a graduation act in university, and others to a religious service while they were kidnapped. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown. 1 injured.

On 26 March 2023, in Les Cayes, Sud, gang members on a motorcycle chased a business man from the public market area to his home in Charpentier neighbourhood, and shot and killed him (drive-by). Motivation of the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.
Around 26 March 2023 (week of), in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, people protested in the La Plaine neighbourhood to ask for peace and security.

On 25 March 2023, Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, members of rival gangs clashed in the vicinity of the Terminal Varreux SA facilities, in La Saline area. An oil tanker was damaged by the bullets. Casualties unknown.
Property destruction: Around 23 March 2023 (week of), in Baraderes, Nippes, unidentified gang members stole several motorbikes and vandalized stores in the la Plaine zone.

source: Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 23 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified gang members shot and killed a man and injured a friend of his during a kidnapping attempt at Delmas 75. The target was the killed man. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 23 March 2023, in Les Cayes, Sud, unidentified gang members shot and killed a vendor and injured two other people on the Quatre-Chemins boulevard. Motivation of the attack is unknown. 1 fatality, 2 injured.
On 23 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, Ti Makak gang members abducted six members of a family, including two children, in Laboule 12. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

Around 23 March 2023 (as reported), in Cap-Haitien, Nord, masked gang members entered the Justinien Hospital and attacked health workers. No further information on the event was reported. Casualties unknown.

On 22 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the third consecutive day, employees of the National Archive held a demonstration to demand the release of one of their colleagues who was abducted on 15 March (coded separately). Demonstrators blocked roads with burning tires.

On 22 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, gang members shot and killed a man while gunfire was heard in the Thomassin neighborhood. The motivation for the attack was related to gang-related retaliation. 1 fatality.
On 21 March 2023, in Leogane, Leogane, residents demanded the release of five members of a musical band that were kidnapped on 18 March (coded separately). They barricaded National Road Number 2.

On 21 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, employees of the National Archive held a demonstration to demand the release of one of their colleagues who was abducted on 15 March (coded separately).
On 21 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a student of the Superior School was shot and killed in the centre. Motivation and perpetrators of the attack were unknown. 1 fatality.
On 21 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, gang members opened fire and set several houses on fire in the Thomassin neighborhood.

On 21 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, gang members attacked the General Director of the National Airport Authority and some of his close employees in Delmas 75. Perpetrators shot and killed his driver and injured one of his security guards. Motivations and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality, 2 injured.
On 20 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, employees of the National Archive held a demonstration to demand the release of one of their colleagues who was abducted on 15 March (coded separately).

On 20 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified armed men abducted a lawyer on his way back from work. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, but the latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.
On 20 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified gang members shot and killed a police officer close to his residence in Delmas 18. Perpetrators burned the victim's body. 1 fatality.

On 20 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, unidentified gang members abducted a man and a woman. He was a former judge at the Court of first instance, and she was the mother of the former judge's son. She was released a week later, while he was liberated 20 days after, on 8 April. In both cases, the release occurred after a ransom payment, whose nature and conditions were unclear.

source: CARDH: Center for Analysis and Research in Human Rights; Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 20 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, Vitelhomme gang members shot and killed more than 10 civilians and injured a number of others. At least nine bodies were burned. There was a police officer among the victims. Four of the victims were in a van. Perpetrators set fire to stores and houses in the Freres, Pernier, Meyotte, Diegue, Girardo, Fort Jacques, Cago, and Tunel neighborhoods. According to reports, the attack was a reprisal against civilians after they lynched three gang members the day before (coded separately). More than 10 fatalities.

source: CARDH: Center for Analysis and Research in Human Rights; Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 19 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, rioters lynched and burned three members of the Vitelhomme gang in Moulin Sable area. In retaliation, gangsters set fire to stores and houses in several neighborhoods the day after (coded separately). 3 fatalities.

On 18 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gang members shot and killed a man during an abduction attempt in Port-au-Prince downtown. The victim was the head of the Bank of the Republic of Haiti (BRH). 1 fatality.

source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Progress; Jamaica Gleaner; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 18 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members kidnapped three American citizens of Haitian descent, a man, a woman, and another relative, during a bus ride in Martissant. However, after the ransom was paid, the perpetrators asked for additional 400,000 dollars and did not release the victims. The victims were liberated on 13 April, after a second ransom was paid.

On 18 March 2023, in Leogane, Ouest, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang abducted five musical band members from a public transport bus in the Martissant area. The victims were held somewhere in the same area. They were released on 10 April after a ransom payment.

Around 17 March 2023 (as reported), in Les Cayes, Sud, unidentified armed individuals killed and burned a man and the victim's body was found on 17 March at the Quatre Chemins street. According to residents, the victim was a thief. 1 fatality.

source: Haiti Progress; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 17 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, gang members dressed as agents of the Central Directorate of the Judicial Police abducted the CEO of the Radio RCH 2000, who is also a police officer, in Delmas 35. The victim was released on 25 March in Port-au-Prince after a ransom had been paid.

source: Haiti Standard; Loop News Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 17 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang in vehicles and on motorbikes shot and killed at least four people and then burned their bodies in the Malique neighborhood (drive-by). They burned more than half a dozen vehicles and a store. The attack occurred after Prime Minister Ariel Henry announced to call for the military to support police forces to fight gangs. At least 4 fatalities.

On 16 March 2023, in L'Estere, Artibonite, Kokorat San Ras gang members abducted six employees of the rice company 'Ti Malice'. The gang members demanded ransom. The victims were released on 19 March.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 16 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gang members killed at least nine residents in the Corridor Bastia area. Some of the victims were burned or decapitated. Although the affiliation of the killers was not clarified, the attack took place as clashes between the Base Krache Dife Gang and the Belair Gang erupted in the area days before, between 27 February and 6 March (coded separately), resulting in the killing of civilians. At least 9 fatalities.

On 15 March 2023, in Arcahaie, Ouest, police forces clashed with more than fifty gang members as they were looting and vandalizing the Hotel Wahoo Bay Beach Club & Resort. Staff members and security guards of the hotel fled. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 15 March 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo gang set three vehicles on fire in the Lilavois neighbourhood. The passengers fled from the vehicles. Motivation of the destruction is unknown.

On 15 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals abducted an employee of the National Archives in Turgeau neighbourhood. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, but latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim was released between 25 and 26 March in Port-au-Prince under unknown circumstances.
On 14 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, students of the Colleges Alexandre Petion and Daniel Fignole held a demonstration to denounce insecurity in school.

On 14 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, employees of the National Centre for Equipment staged a sit-in demonstration on Bois-Vernat street to demand payment of their salaries for the last six months. Demonstrators blocked the traffic in the area. Police forces dispersed demonstrators by unknown methods and injured several demonstrators. Authorities' intervention was described as police brutality.

Around 13 March 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals killed two people and their burned bodies were found on 13 March. Motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 13 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several individuals, some of them wearing school uniforms and some of them hooded, looted and destructed property as a demonstration to demand the closure of the two high schools. Rioters destroyed the windows of vehicles and barriers. Police forces prevented the group from destructing other objects (by unknown methods).

notes: On 13 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, police arrested a leader of an unidentified gang operating in Fond-Cochon, at the Hospital Adventist de Diquini. The gang leader is accused of killing, rape, and theft of cattle, among other charges.

notes: On 12 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gang members killed a man (methods unknown) and burned his body when he was about to reach his residence on Timerasse Street in the Corridor Bastia area. On 11 March 2023, in Cabaret, Ouest, an unidentified armed group clashed with the Titanyen gang in the Source Matelas neighbourhood, where four people were shot and killed, and in the Titanyen area, where six others were shot and killed. On 10 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified armed men abducted an employee of the Institute for Social Wellbeing and Research in the centre close to the National Palace. The perpetrators demanded 200.000 US Dollars for ransom. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 10 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gang members set fire to a house on Timerasse Street in the Corridor Bastia area. The owner of the house, who was inside, went missing. On 9 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several gang members in the Thomassin neighbourhood after the gang members invaded a house of a police officer. Two gang members were killed inside the house, and others around the area, although the exact number of gang members killed was not specified. At least 3 fatalities.

On 9 March 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, gang members on motorbikes shot and killed two individuals, including a child, close to the public market Lacoupe and the Freres area (drive-by). notes: On 8 January 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gang members shot and injured the President of the Senate in his car on his way to the Senate in the center. A police officer accompanying the victim then shot and killed one of the gang members. The gang members fled in one of the victim's car. Motivation of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

Around 7 January 2023 (between 5 - 10 January), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, unidentified gang members occupied the facilities of the catholic Daughters of Mary congregation, the Queen Sophia School of Spain, the infirmary and other infrastructures of the congregation in the neighbourhood of La Tremblay. They shot an unknown number of civilians. There were no casualties.

On 6 January 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified individuals abducted a musician of the group DISIP in a bus in Martissant neighbourhood. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, but the latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The kidnappers released him a few hours later.

On 5 January 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, gang members on motorbikes shot and killed two men in a drive-by attack in Laboule 12 neighbourhood. Motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 3 January 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces clashed with several members of the Ti Makak gang, shooting and killing three gang members, in Thomassin neighbourhood. Three police officers were injured during the clash. The gang members had previously attempted a kidnapping. 3 fatalities, 3 injured.
On 3 January 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a member of the Canaan gang in the Tibob and Nan Pitimi area. Two other gang members fled. 1 fatality.

On 2 January 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the 400 Mawozo gang and shot and killed three of them in the locality of Duval. One police officer was injured during the clash. Motivation of the clash is unknown. 3 fatalities, 1 injured.

notes: On 2 January 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals kidnapped a former deputy of the commune of Paillant and Petite-Riviere in the Nippes department -- affiliated with Fanmi Lavalas -- as well as members of his family and his driver in the neighbourhood of Merger. The members of his family were released by the perpetrators. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, but the latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims were released for ransom on 12 January. According to other reports, the abduction occurred in Carrefour.
On 1 January 2023, in Maissade, Centre, police forces arrested the leader of the 400 Egare gang.
